message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss the purchase of this amazing product with you! I think it's a game-changer, and I'm confident you'll love it. I'm willing to offer it to you for $10000. It's a great deal, if I do say so myself!
I appreciate your enthusiasm for the product, Alice. However, I was thinking more along the lines of $8000. I'm willing to make a serious offer, but I need to make sure it's a good deal for me.

Thank you for your offer, Bob! I understand you're looking for a good deal, and I appreciate your seriousness. However, I'm not willing to go as low as $8000. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer it to you for $9500. It's still a great price, and I think you'll be happy with the value you're getting.

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, Alice, but I'm still a bit above that price. I'm willing to pay $9000 for the product. I think it's a fair price considering the value it will bring to me.

I understand your concerns, Bob, and I appreciate your persistence. However, I'm not willing to go as low as $9000. I'm willing to make one more concession and offer it to you for $9250. It's still a great deal, and I think you'll be happy with the value you're getting. Let's meet in the middle and make a deal!

I appreciate your persistence, Alice, but I'm still not convinced that $9250 is the best price for me. I'm willing to pay $9000, and that's my final offer. If you're not willing to meet me at that price, I'll have to consider other options.

I understand you're firm on your price, Bob, and I respect that. However, I'm not willing to sell the product at $9000. I'm willing to make one more counteroffer, and I'll meet you halfway between $9250 and $9000. I'll offer it to you for $9125. This is my final offer, and I hope we can come to an agreement.

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, Alice, but I'm still not willing to go above $9000. I'm going to stick to my previous offer and see if you're willing to meet me at that price. I'm confident that it's a fair price for the product.

I understand you're firm on your price, Bob, but I'm not willing to sell the product at $9000. I'm willing to make one more concession and offer it to you for $9050. This is my final offer, and I hope we can come to an agreement.

Alice, I appreciate your persistence, but I'm still not willing to go above $9000. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I'm not budging from that number. I'm willing to pay $9000 for the product, and that's my final offer.
